About

I currently live in downtown Chicago, Illinois and work as the Creative Director for Threadmeup.

I also manage a variety of projects, watch cheesy horror movies, hang out at arcades, and listen to loud music.

Learn More

Skills

My experience, thus far, has been in working with large-scale news media and e-commerce platforms.

• UI/UX Design

I design interfaces for responsive web, iOS, and Android, as well as build their respective UX— Wireframes, user-studies, sitemaps, high-fidelity mocks, and prototypes.

• Front-End Development

I prepare the entire customer-facing visuals of responsive websites (HTML, CSS) for back-end developers. I also build static websites from scratch or using the Bootstrap framework.

• Branding/Identity

I craft strong visual identities, which include logos, branding, and style guidelines. I also occasionally develop collateral identity items such as business cards, letterheads, posters, and packaging.

• Illustration

I create vectorized spot illustrations, iconography, and larger-scale pieces.

  • The Best Way to Find After-School Activities for Your Kids
    February 16, 2015
    Published in Case-Study
    0 Comments

    In the summer of 2014, I was approached by my former Aggrego co-worker, Sal Abassi, to help get a personal project off the ground; that project would be Afterskoolz. As a parent, he felt there was an opportunity to create a platform to make finding and planning after-school activiites for his children easier. Sal, alongside fellow parent and Afterskoolz co-founder, Mustafa Patni, laid out their vision of the ideal product and all...

  • The World Revolves Around the Sun
    February 15, 2015
    Published in Case-Study
    0 Comments

    The last project I did with Aggrego is most certainly the largest, and for me, the most significant in my career thus far. I did not expect to be the lead designer of a prestigious product or brand, such as the Chicago Sun-Times, so soon. But, as luck/fortune would have it, I was given the opportunity to not only redesign it, but extend it's reach across 70 of the largest cities in the US. We started working on the "Sun-Times Network" late summer 2014 initially...

    Continue Reading
  • Bringing the News to the Carribean
    February 14, 2015
    Published in Case-Study
    0 Comments

    It's not every day you get to design a product for entire countries like Jamaica and Haiti, so when Aggrego was brought in to design the digital news network, "Loop", in Spring 2014, I was definitely excited. Digicel, a communications company that handles phones in the Carribean, wanted to capitalize on their significant involment in their customers' lives by creating the ultimate source....

    Continue Reading
  • Redesigning the Pioneer Press
    February 13, 2015
    Published in Case-Study
    0 Comments

    One of the first major projects I worked on at Aggrego was the redesign of the Pioneer Press. The Pioneer Press is a collection of 30+ local news websites covering the Chicago suburbs (under the Chicago Sun-Times umbrella) The goal wasn't simply an aesthetic improvement, but an improvement to the overall product: We made the desktop-only website responsive, added iOS/Android Apps, and created a network to connect them all...
